messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `routes/admin.php`, I found that `PostThumbnailController@destroy` is imported to process HTTP requests to the path `/posts/{post}/thumbnail`. I'll provide you with the contents of file `routes/admin.php`, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to find files that contain the implementation of `PostThumbnailController@destroy`. You must focus on the implementation itself and ignore unit tests or functional tests. You need to output a list of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations, ensuring that each path is relative to the project's directory. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
Files containing the handler implementation (relative to project root):

- app/Http/Controllers/Admin/PostThumbnailController.php

Explanation:

- The route in routes/admin.php maps DELETE /posts/{post}/thumbnail to PostThumbnailController@destroy.
- I searched the codebase for the controller class and found its implementation at app/Http/Controllers/Admin/PostThumbnailController.php.
- The file defines class PostThumbnailController and includes the destroy(Post $post): RedirectResponse method, which unsets the post's thumbnail (sets thumbnail_id to null) and redirects back to the admin.posts.edit route with a success message.
- I ignored tests and only inspected source files. Commands used to locate the file included a recursive grep and viewing the file contents.
